item.description:
Hi folks! October lends itself to some of the best hiking, with blue skies, crispy clean weather, and hopefully some autumn color! Let's partake in a fun, invigorating, Saturday morning hike to christen the fall.

LOCATION: This first Meetup will be at Sleeping Giant, which is a Connecticut State Park located in Hamden.

PLAN: Sleeping Giant is a great park for any level of hiking, but we'd like to try a modest trail for the first Meetup. The "castle trail" is relatively short, has a mild incline, and requires little maneuvering over rocky places - the trail consists of a wide gravel road.

WHEN AND WHERE: Meet at the entrance, which is located on Mt. Carmel Avenue, between 7:45 and 8, and we'll try to get rolling onto the trail by 8:15. This particular hike shouldn't take more than 2.5 hours.

BRING: water! (And a snack if you like.)

DIRECTIONS: Please see link below.

PARKING NOTE: There is no fee for parking in the lot after Labor Day. However, if the lot is full (probably not, at 8 a.m.), please take advantage of the street parking on Mt. Carmel Avenue adjacent to park, ACROSS FROM (not inside) Quinnipiac University.

Link to park website:
Sleeping Giant State Park Website
item.how_to_find_us: Organizer (Sarah) will be wearing a blue and red rugby shirt and green cap.

group.name: New Haven Walks in the Woods

item.name: New Haven Early-bird Hiking October Meetup
